['', 'Demonstrated ability to facilitate complex, mission critical projects and to participate in multi-disciplinary work teams and the ability to quickly understand business processes and translate into data requirements.', 'Ensure quality of data ingestion processes meet business and solution needs.', 'Participates in and presents at technical meetings, seminars and conferences for HIS.', 'Lead the technical solution implementation for core Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes associated with USAID/OHA systems primarily the Development Data Commons (DDC).Develop, maintain, test, evaluate, and document data ingestion processes and data pipelines.Implement data models and database schemas aligned with existing and emerging data sources to be analyzed within USAID/OHA systems.Lead transformation analysis and design, analysis of data systems, developing ingestion routines, and pre-ingestion data management.Ensure quality of data ingestion processes meet business and solution needs.Prepare and review project artifacts describing and documenting pipeline processing, data flows, table structures, and data dictionaries as needed.Participates in and presents at technical meetings, seminars and conferences for HIS.', 'The hiring of this position will be through the PHI and as such the selected person will become a PHI employee.', 'Credence and its partner, the Public Health Institute (PHI), are both employers for the Global Health Technical Professionals (GHTP) project which provides expertise in support of USAID global health programs.', 'Lead transformation analysis and design, analysis of data systems, developing ingestion routines, and pre-ingestion data management.', 'Summary Statement', 'Qualifications', 'Demonstrated Data Engineering and Data Management experience.', 'The U.S. Government’s (USG) engagement to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS is a top priority worldwide. The USG response includes coordination among the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Department of Defense (DOD), Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Peace Corps (PC), and other entities. This initiative is collectively known as the U.S. President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR). USAID has been at the forefront of the USG’s response to provide quality HIV/AIDS services to over one hundred countries to mitigate the health crisis that threatens the prosperity, stability and development of these nations.', 'The SIEI Health Informatics Branch Chief will serve as his/her USAID Point of Contact (POC).', 'Complete and execute and Individual Learning and Training Plan and Annual Work Plan.', 'Hands-on experience with traditional and/or modern ETL tools (e.g. Trifacta, Alteryx, Informatica, etc.) and big-data processing (e.g. Spark).', 'Ability to adhere to task timelines and deliverable schedules and share concerns about deliverables, timelines, and issues with stakeholders.', 'Minimum of a Master’s degree in computer science, public health, health informatics, other relevant discipline is required and 7 years of relevant experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience; or alternatively, must have a Bachelor’s degree in relevant field and 9 years of relevant professional experience.', 'Responsibilities', 'Hands-on experience with traditional and modern databases such as SQL (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB).', 'Familiarity with Jupyter Notebooks and working knowledge of programming in Python and R.', 'Experience in developing and delivering end-user training materials highly desired.', 'Ability to travel internationally if necessary up to 10%.', 'Strong teamwork, multi-stakeholder collaboration and management skills.', 'US citizenship or US permanent residence with the ability to obtain and maintain a facility access clearance is required.', 'Develop, maintain, test, evaluate, and document data ingestion processes and data pipelines.', 'Deepen knowledge of current literature, research, policies and programmatic experiences related to the HIV response.', 'At least 5 years of professional experience with two or more technical disciplines such as (data science, research, database management etc); job duties/responsibilities specifically related to PD requirements.', '\xa0Training and Professional Development:', 'Overview', 'The Bureau for Global Health’s Office of HIV/AIDS (GH/OHA) is the center of HIV/AIDS technical leadership for USAID and has primary responsibility for the Agency’s HIV/AIDS program. OHA provides strategic direction, technical leadership, and support to field-based HIV/AIDS programs. The Strategic Information, Evaluation, and Informatics Division (SIEI) within OHA, to which the Data Engineer will be assigned, provides technical expertise to advance and support effective strategic information systems and promotes data-driven program planning. The SIEI Division has primary responsibility of supporting USAID headquarters and its Missions to manage and utilize data systems to improve impact and accountability of HIV/AIDS programs. As part of this work, the SIEI Division develops and maintains USAID internal data systems and analytic platforms to support the Agency in its work to analyze and use data for decision making within the PEPFAR program related to performance, efficiency, and quality of care.', 'Ability to be effective in high-pressure situations, juggle multiple tasks simultaneously, problem solve in a fast-paced environment and set priorities.', 'More fully understand the key characteristics of PEPFAR and other HIV and public health data sources for analytic use.', 'The Data Engineer will be a member of the Health Informatics Branch in the Strategic Information, Evaluation and Informatics (SIEI) Division in the Office of HIV/AIDS within USAID’s Bureau for Global Health.\xa0Broad responsibilities will include providing technical leadership and performing work in support of data management activities related to the Office of HIV/AIDS’ centrally-managed systems used to support the operational management of its Global PEPFAR programs. Areas of focus will include supporting the development and operations of the Development Data Commons (DDC), USAID’s enterprise solution for data ingestion, consolidation, and analytics.', 'Participate in professional meetings as appropriate to the position description.', '\xa0', 'Job Requirements', 'Implement data models and database schemas aligned with existing and emerging data sources to be analyzed within USAID/OHA systems.', 'More fully understand the key characteristics of PEPFAR and other HIV and public health data sources for analytic use.Increased knowledge of tools, techniques and frameworks for data ingestion, management, visualization, predictive analytics and machine learning.Deepen knowledge of current literature, research, policies and programmatic experiences related to the HIV response.Participate in professional meetings as appropriate to the position description.Participate in professional continuing education, skills training and professional meetings to enhance relevant technical skills and career development.Complete and execute and Individual Learning and Training Plan and Annual Work Plan.', 'Minimum of a Master’s degree in computer science, public health, health informatics, other relevant discipline is required and 7 years of relevant experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience; or alternatively, must have a Bachelor’s degree in relevant field and 9 years of relevant professional experience.At least 5 years of professional experience with two or more technical disciplines such as (data science, research, database management etc); job duties/responsibilities specifically related to PD requirements.Demonstrated Data Engineering and Data Management experience.Hands-on experience with traditional and/or modern ETL tools (e.g. Trifacta, Alteryx, Informatica, etc.) and big-data processing (e.g. Spark).Hands-on experience with traditional and modern databases such as SQL (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB).Familiarity with Jupyter Notebooks and working knowledge of programming in Python and R.Excellent oral, written, and presentation communication skills. Strong negotiation and group facilitation skills; ability to move a process forward, while meeting the needs of a variety of stakeholders.Experience in developing and delivering end-user training materials highly desired.Demonstrated ability to facilitate complex, mission critical projects and to participate in multi-disciplinary work teams and the ability to quickly understand business processes and translate into data requirements.Ability to adhere to task timelines and deliverable schedules and share concerns about deliverables, timelines, and issues with stakeholders.Strong teamwork, multi-stakeholder collaboration and management skills.Ability to be effective in high-pressure situations, juggle multiple tasks simultaneously, problem solve in a fast-paced environment and set priorities.Ability to travel internationally if necessary up to 10%.US citizenship or US permanent residence with the ability to obtain and maintain a facility access clearance is required.', 'The Data Engineer will assist USAID staff in conducting data triangulation activities using tools like Trifacta; monitor data submission errors and communicate issues to data submitters; write code in Python or R for custom data extraction and manipulation; manage backend user access rights and roles; generate export files per user requests, working closely with OHA Data Scientists and Analysts to provide them with the data they need. As the system evolves, the Data Engineer will also provide end-user orientation and training on DDC operations, interfacing with OHA staff to develop requirements and work with the contractor to convert them into system specifications, data ingestion pipelines, and operational processes.\xa0S/he will also work closely with the technical teams at headquarters and field-based counterparts to provide technical assistance on issues pertaining to data management and governance.\xa0', 'Participate in professional continuing education, skills training and professional meetings to enhance relevant technical skills and career development.', 'Excellent oral, written, and presentation communication skills. Strong negotiation and group facilitation skills; ability to move a process forward, while meeting the needs of a variety of stakeholders.', 'Prepare and review project artifacts describing and documenting pipeline processing, data flows, table structures, and data dictionaries as needed.', 'Lead the technical solution implementation for core Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes associated with USAID/OHA systems primarily the Development Data Commons (DDC).', 'Increased knowledge of tools, techniques and frameworks for data ingestion, management, visualization, predictive analytics and machine learning.', 'Global Health Technical Professionals (GHTP) is a US Agency for International Development (USAID) program that offers early- to mid-career global health professionals the opportunity to advance their careers supporting the USAID Bureau for Global Health and its implementing partners. GHTP is helping USAID improve global health outcomes in communities around the world by building a new generation of global health technical professionals who reflect the diversity of the American people.']

job_title: Research Scientist, Demography and Survey Science - University Grad
job_text: ['', 'Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)Experience with Bayesian statistical modelsExperience with primary data collectionExperience with field experiments, experimental design, missing data, survey sampling, and/or panel dataExperience with observational causal inference (e.g., regression adjustment, matching, propensity score stratification), or quasi-experimental methods (e.g., instrumental variables, regression discontinuity, interrupted time series)Experience with bandit optimization, adaptive experimentation, and/or job_title: Principal Research Scientist I, Computational Immunology, Rheumatological Lead
job_text: ['', 'Identify relevant internal and external data and knowledge resources and propose integration mechanisms for data integration', 'Collaborate with research & clinical scientists to conceive informatics analysis strategy and independently execute bioinformatics analysis, particularly focusing on functional interpretation and hypothesis generation that support discovery, pre-clinical studies and development projects such as new target identification, patient stratification and biomarker development', 'Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo.', 'Hands on experience in genomics (single cell preferred), immunoprofiling (CyTOF, immune cell repertoire) data analyses using existing and custom pipelines are preferred.', 'Qualifications: ', 'Fluent in scientific scripting languages such as R, Perl/Python. Very comfortable working in both linux and windows environment.', 'Qualifications', ' Act as the rheumatological disease lead within the Systems Computational Biology group for data and computational strategies for rheumatological diseases, including but not limiting to rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, and Sjogren’s disease Collaborate with research & clinical scientists to conceive informatics analysis strategy and independently execute bioinformatics analysis, particularly focusing on functional interpretation and hypothesis generation that support discovery, pre-clinical studies and development projects such as new target identification, patient stratification and biomarker development Collaborate with bioinformatics scientists and data engineers for complex and integrated bioinformatics analyses leveraging available genetic and multi-omics datasets  Identify relevant internal and external data and knowledge resources and propose integration mechanisms for data integration Be abreast with most current systems analysis and machine learning methodology and algorithms and introduce them in-house when appropriate. Communicate analytical analysis verbally and in writing for scientific and technical audiences. Mentor junior computational scientists ', 'Be abreast with most current systems analysis and machine learning methodology and algorithms and introduce them in-house when appropriate.', 'PhD in Biological sciences (immunology strongly preferred) with strong quantitative background, involving the analysis of large scale complex data such as next generation sequencing, populational genetics, with typically 6+ years of experience.', 'About AbbVie', 'Act as the rheumatological disease lead within the Systems Computational Biology group for data and computational strategies for rheumatological diseases, including but not limiting to rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, and Sjogren’s disease', 'Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement.', 'Significant Work Activities', 'Knowledge in functional analysis tools (IPA, GSEA, etc.) and relevant databases (GEO, GTEX, DICE, etc.) and experience in developing custom computational analysis pipeline leveraging these resources is highly preferred', ' PhD in Biological sciences (immunology strongly preferred) with strong quantitative background, involving the analysis of large scale complex data such as next generation sequencing, populational genetics, with typically 6+ years of experience. Hands on experience in genomics (single cell preferred), immunoprofiling (CyTOF, immune cell repertoire) data analyses using existing and custom pipelines are preferred. Experience in research project management is required. Knowledge in functional analysis tools (IPA, GSEA, etc.) and relevant databases (GEO, GTEX, DICE, etc.) and experience in developing custom computational analysis pipeline leveraging these resources is highly preferred Fluent in scientific scripting languages such as R, Perl/Python. Very comfortable working in both linux and windows environment. ', 'Mentor junior computational scientists', 'Job Level Code', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'Experience in research project management is required.', 'Key Responsibilities', 'Builds strong relationships with peers and cross functionally with partners outside of the team to enable higher performance.', 'Travel', 'Collaborate with bioinformatics scientists and data engineers for complex and integrated bioinformatics analyses leveraging available genetic and multi-omics datasets ', 'Key AbbVie Competencies', ' Builds strong relationships with peers and cross functionally with partners outside of the team to enable higher performance. Learns fast, grasps the “essence” and can change the course quickly where indicated. Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo. Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement. Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality. job_title: Machine Learning Engineer: up to $250,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. They have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We raised $18 million in Series A from Decibel Ventures and Eric Schmidt. We are looking for talented machine learning software engineers, systems software engineers and research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Candidates will need to have a BS or MS from top notch CS programs with industry experience. We are looking for machine learning software engineers who have experience building at least one of the following: ML/AI models which are in production New neural network algorithms based on research papers Low level performance optimization of deep learning systems Machine learning platforms', 'Job Description:', 'Responsibilities:', 'Company Description:', 'Responsible for implementing various algorithms to do automated feature extraction and dataset augmentation, optimizing runtimes of neural network algorithms and building higher level abstractions for various common AI/ML techniques.', 'General Requirements:']

job_title: Principal Institute Research Scientist - In Vitro Pharmacology
job_text: ['', ' Working closely with research teams, identify and recommend opportunities for scientific discovery and clinical therapeutic drug development.', 'JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES', ' Work with external groups to implement novel lead finding activities with collaborators as appropriate.', ' Transfer assays to collaborators as appropriate.', ' Supervise associate scientists.', 'Education', ' Coordinate the application and development of cutting edge tools and methodologies to enable advancement of Institute projects through leadership and experimental activities. Analyze data generated by various studies and leverage results for the design of future studies.', ' Coordinate the application and development of cutting edge tools and methodologies to enable advancement of Institute projects through leadership and experimental activities. Analyze data generated by various studies and leverage results for the design of future studies. Working closely with research teams, identify and recommend opportunities for scientific discovery and clinical therapeutic drug development. Provide in vitro pharmacology leadership on multidisciplinary drug discovery teams. Interact closely with cross-functional groups, including biology and medicinal chemistry, on discovery-based project teams. Responsible for the design and execution of robust cellular, biochemical, and biophysical assays to support target validation, hit identification and confirmation, and lead optimization in small molecule drug discovery projects. Responsible for the characterization of the mechanism of action of novel small molecules. Monitor assay quality and troubleshoot issues with assay performance. Contribute to project teams through lab-based activities. Work with external groups to implement novel lead finding activities with collaborators as appropriate. Transfer assays to collaborators as appropriate. Provide leadership in enhancing the 3D cellular assay and high-content imaging capabilities of IACS for screening funnel purposes and mechanistic studies. Supervise associate scientists.', ' Responsible for the characterization of the mechanism of action of novel small molecules.', ' Provide in vitro pharmacology leadership on multidisciplinary drug discovery teams.', 'Preferred', ' Provide leadership in enhancing the 3D cellular assay and high-content imaging capabilities of IACS for screening funnel purposes and mechanistic studies.', ' Responsible for the design and execution of robust cellular, biochemical, and biophysical assays to support target validation, hit identification and confirmation, and lead optimization in small molecule drug discovery projects.', 'Experience', ' Monitor assay quality and troubleshoot issues with assay performance.', ' Contribute to project teams through lab-based activities.', ' Interact closely with cross-functional groups, including biology and medicinal chemistry, on discovery-based project teams.']

job_title: Machine Learning Engineer: up to $250,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. They have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We raised $18 million in Series A from Decibel Ventures and Eric Schmidt. We are looking for talented machine learning software engineers, systems software engineers and research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Candidates will need to have a BS or MS from top notch CS programs with industry experience. We are looking for machine learning software engineers who have experience building at least one of the following: ML/AI models which are in production New neural network algorithms based on research papers Low level performance optimization of deep learning systems Machine learning platforms', 'Job Description:', 'Responsibilities:', 'Company Description:', 'Responsible for implementing various algorithms to do automated feature extraction and dataset augmentation, optimizing runtimes of neural network algorithms and building higher level abstractions for various common AI/ML techniques.', 'General Requirements:']

['', ' Master\'s Degree in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) ', ' At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis ', ' Innovative: You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them. ', ' Leverage a broad stack of technologies - Python, AWS, GitHub RedShift, and more - to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of recruiting data ', " Statistically-minded: You've built models, validated them, and backtested them. You know how to interpret a confusion matrix or a ROC curve. You have experience with clustering, classification, sentiment analysis, time series, NLP and deep learning. ", ' Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup, we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 100 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. ', ' Master\'s Degree in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics)  At least 1 year of experience working with AWS At least 1 year experience with NLP At least 3 years\' experience in Python, Scala, or R  At least 3 years\' experience with machine learning  At least 3 years\' experience with SQL ', ' The People Analytics Center of Excellence at Capital One is a 75 person cross-functional team of analysts, consultants, and data scientists. The People Analytics Talent Assessment & Analytics team builds models that help Capital One assess and select great talent. We partner with vendors to implement world class assessment solutions for the business, as well as develop our own. We derive insights, build models and develop strategies using Python, AWS, and other open-source technology. We deliver analytics to internal customers in intelligent and real time custom web applications. ', " Bachelor's Degree plus 5 years of experience in data analytics, or Master's Degree plus 3 years in data analytics, or PhD  At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis  At least 1 year of experience with machine learning  At least 1 year of experience with relational databases ", ' Building custom models to assess quality of hire for a given function or more broadly, all in service of developing better candidate assessment solutions ', 'At least 1 year experience with NLP', ' Build models and perform analyses centered on helping Capital One assess and select great talent. ', " As a Data Scientist on Capital One's People Analytics team, you'll be on the leading edge of applying analytics to talent, combining machine learning and social science to build strategies that expand Capital One's talent advantage. ", 'These Could Include', ' Build predictive models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation ', ' Optimizing each aspect of our recruiting operation from assessing, selecting and hiring candidates to sourcing & engaging them. ', ' Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.', ' Writing white papers that explain predictive models you have developed ', " Creative: You thrive on bringing definition to big, undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You're not afraid to share a new idea. ", 'Basic Qualifications', " At least 3 years' experience in Python, Scala, or R ", " At least 3 years' experience with machine learning ", 'In This Role, You Will', 'Role Description', " Bachelor's Degree plus 5 years of experience in data analytics, or Master's Degree plus 3 years in data analytics, or PhD ", ' At least 1 year of experience working with AWS ', ' Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business outcomes ', " At least 3 years' experience with SQL ", 'The Ideal Candidate is', ' At least 1 year of experience with relational databases ', ' Supporting our efforts to deploy assessment technologies using best in class fairness methods. ', ' At least 1 year of experience with machine learning ', 'Preferred Qualifications', " Technical: You're comfortable with open-source languages and are passionate about developing further. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms. ", 'Team Description']

['', ' Demonstrable ability in data modeling, ETL development, and Data warehousing, or similar skills.', ' 5+ years of hands-on experience in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large data sets.', ' Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.', " Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative/technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering) or equivalent work experience. 5+ years of relevant experience in one of the following areas: Data engineering, database engineering, business intelligence or business analytics. 5+ years of hands-on experience in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large data sets. Demonstrable ability in data modeling, ETL development, and Data warehousing, or similar skills. Experience building/operating systems for data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets involving petabytes of data. Demonstrable advanced skills and experience using SQL with large data sets (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server, Redshift) Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles.", ' Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources.', ' Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles.', ' Knowledge of software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including Agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.', ' Excellent verbal & written communications skills with ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner.', ' Experience developing tools for data engineers and machine learning', ' Design, build, and maintain an analytical platform providing access to large datasets and computing power. Design, build and maintain data clusters providing access and insights for business needs. Design build and maintain data pipelines using AWS Data Pipelines or other equivalent technologies to transport relevant data to the right destinations. Implement data structures using best practices in data modeling. Collaborate with Data Scientists to implement advanced analytics algorithms that exploit our rich data sets for statistical analysis, prediction, clustering and machine learning. job_title: Senior Scientist II / Principal Research Scientist I, Cellular Biology
job_text: ['', 'Lead and mentor a team of highly motivated and gifted scientists.', 'Proficiency in a wide range of molecular biology and immunology techniques (qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA, FACS) for characterization of different aspects of cell biology and a willingness to adopt new skills as needed ', 'Qualifications', 'Demonstrated ability to plan, execute and troubleshoot experiments to generate reliable and reproducible data in timely manner.', 'About AbbVie', 'Experience with different imaging techniques and image analysis is highly desirable.', " BS in Biology or related field with typically 12 - 14+ years of experience; MS or equivalent education with typically 10 - 12+ years of experience; PhD with typically 4 - 6+ years of experience in metabolic diseases, immunology, oncology, aging or related area of discipline. Hands-on experience with mammal cell culture techniques, sterile tissue processing, primary cell isolation and handling. Proficiency in a wide range of molecular biology and immunology techniques (qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA, FACS) for characterization of different aspects of cell biology and a willingness to adopt new skills as needed  Expertise in rodent handling, multiple dosing, physical evaluation and measurement techniques, blood collection, small surgery, in vivo imaging, necropsy, tissue collection and processing for various downstream applications. Experience with different imaging techniques and image analysis is highly desirable. Demonstrated ability to plan, execute and troubleshoot experiments to generate reliable and reproducible data in timely manner. Demonstrate creative 'out of the box' thinking to solve difficult technical problems and champion new technologies to achieve project goals. Experienced and demonstrated success as primary author of publications, presentations, regulatory documents and/or primary inventor of patents. Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organization skills, ability to work in a demanding and intellectually challenging environment, teamwork across multiple scientific disciplines and functions ", 'Significant Work Activities', 'Process animal tissues and execution of downstream ex vivo analyses including qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA and FACS.', 'The individual will be fully integrated into several project teams and accountable for the prosecution of project activities leading to team success.', 'Job Level Code', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'Plan and execute in vivo and ex vivo experiments to characterize biologics with novel mechanisms of action. ', 'Develop strategic vision, provide scientific leadership and technical guidance to build a robust panel of in vitro assays to support the discovery, screening, and characterization of novel biologics.', 'Demonstrated ability to function as a principle investigator, generating original technical ideas and research strategies.', ' Develop strategic vision, provide scientific leadership and technical guidance to build a robust panel of in vitro assays to support the discovery, screening, and characterization of novel biologics. Plan and execute in vivo and ex vivo experiments to characterize biologics with novel mechanisms of action.  Demonstrated ability to function as a principle investigator, generating original technical ideas and research strategies. Lead and mentor a team of highly motivated and gifted scientists. Process animal tissues and execution of downstream ex vivo analyses including qPCR, WB, IHC, ELISA and FACS. Use multiple techniques to study in vivo distribution of novel biologics, target expression and engagement.  The individual will be fully integrated into several project teams and accountable for the prosecution of project activities leading to team success. ', 'Use multiple techniques to study in vivo distribution of novel biologics, target expression and engagement. ', 'Key Responsibilities', 'BS in Biology or related field with typically 12 - 14+ years of experience; MS or equivalent education with typically 10 - 12+ years of experience; PhD with typically 4 - 6+ years of experience in metabolic diseases, immunology, oncology, aging or related area of discipline.', 'Expertise in rodent handling, multiple dosing, physical evaluation and measurement techniques, blood collection, small surgery, in vivo imaging, necropsy, tissue collection and processing for various downstream applications.', 'Travel', 'Experienced and demonstrated success as primary author of publications, presentations, regulatory documents and/or primary inventor of patents.', "Demonstrate creative 'out of the box' thinking to solve difficult technical problems and champion new technologies to achieve project goals.", 'Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organization skills, ability to work in a demanding and intellectually challenging environment, teamwork across multiple scientific disciplines and functions', 'Hands-on experience with mammal cell culture techniques, sterile tissue processing, primary cell isolation and handling.', 'Job Type', 'Schedule']

job_title: Machine Learning Engineer: up to $250,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. They have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We raised $18 million in Series A from Decibel Ventures and Eric Schmidt. We are looking for talented machine learning software engineers, systems software engineers and research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Candidates will need to have a BS or MS from top notch CS programs with industry experience. We are looking for machine learning software engineers who have experience building at least one of the following: ML/AI models which are in production New neural network algorithms based on research papers Low level performance optimization of deep learning systems Machine learning platforms', 'Job Description:', 'Responsibilities:', 'Company Description:', 'Responsible for implementing various algorithms to do automated feature extraction and dataset augmentation, optimizing runtimes of neural network algorithms and building higher level abstractions for various common AI/ML techniques.', 'General Requirements:']

Coeur Value is on a mission to empower clinicians across the United States to consistently deliver higher-quality, prevention-focused, patient-centered care, and enable clinicians to be rewarded for focusing on doing the right things for their patients, and delivering care now that prevents more advanced disease down the line. software platform, and different web-based dashboard interfaces.', 'Previous experience in roles that require significant independent thinking', 'Should be comfortable working with UNIX and characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.', 'Highly experienced with using web-based data presentation programs like Tableau, Periscope, and others ', 'Manipulate data to time, and as we grow, this role will involve building out and leading a highly capable multidisciplinary team of data scientists, analysts, engineers, and clinical experts to inform and oversee this work.', 'Proficient with R and Python', 'Work with seasoned clinicians, experts in population health management, and health services research to:', 'We are looking for a talented and experienced individual to join our growing team as our first Director/VP of Analytics.\xa0This role affords a truly singular opportunity to work closely with a world-class team to help build a disruptive, mission-driven, physician-led clinical delivery organization from the ground up!\xa0', 'We are looking for high integrity, mission-oriented people who are passionate about improving the quality and value of chronic disease care in America, excited to join a dynamic, rapidly-growing, and diverse team, and want to build a disruptive, world-class business.\xa0We are humble and ambitious, learning-oriented and focused on execution, and all in on this venture and vision.\xa0Come join us!', 'We are startup, and, as a startup, everyone in the organization is expected to roll up their sleeves.\xa0This role is no different.\xa0With this context in mind, the DIRECTOR/VP of Analytics’ initial day-to-day responsibilities will include:Helping to vet, choose, and implement different analytics tools, including a population health management software platform, and different web-based dashboard interfaces.Analyze electronic health records, health insurance claims data, and data on clinical practice and health care market characteristics.\xa0These analyses will be conducted in cloud-based settings (i.e. Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure) using one or more of the following as we grow, this role will involve building out and leading a highly capable multidisciplinary team of data scientists, analysts, engineers, and clinical experts to inform and oversee this work.', 'High level summary: This individual will be responsible for leading our data science and analytics work, which will involve using clinical and health insurance claims data to evaluate patterns related to quality and costs of care across geographic regions, clinical practices and hospitals, individual providers, and patients. These analyses will be used to inform not only where we launch our business (i.e. what markets we enter), but also where we focus our efforts to improve quality, reduce total costs of care, and create additional value for ourselves, our patients, and our payor and provider partners. ', 'In addition to the responsibilities listed above, this role will provide critical guidance on applying analytical capabilities and insights to real-world business processes, problems and operations.', '\xa0', 'Key Responsibilities ', 'formulate key questions and analytical objectives', 'Resourceful and assertive:\xa0reaches out and over in order to get things done, and asks for help and clarification when it’s needed', 'right care, in the right place at the right time. ', 'Expertise with excel also essential', 'Skilled at presenting data in tables, graphs, and charts and putting these formats into PowerPoint templates', 'Excited to roll up sleeves, dig in, and get work done with colleagues', 'Analyze electronic health records, health insurance claims data, and data on clinical practice and health care market characteristics.\xa0These analyses will be conducted in cloud-based settings (i.e. Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure) using one or more of the following analytical programs: Microsoft excel, SAS, STATA, and/or R.', 'Advanced\xa0skills/experience with statistical programming and knowledge\xa0of statistical research methodology/principles is essential', 'Our founding team has decades of experience in clinical medicine, payer and provider leadership, government, data science, and clinical operations.\xa0We are deeply passionate about improving care quality, and providing more Americans with access to great, evidence-based chronic disease care. job_title: Principal Research Scientist I/II, Neuroinflammation Drug Discovery
job_text: ['', 'Lead and contribute to target identification and validation research, specifically in the role of neuroinflammation in neurodegenerative diseases. Lead and contribute to drug discovery and advancement research. ', 'Alzheimer’s and/or Parkinson’s disease experience', " PhD in Neuroscience or related field, with typically 6 - 8+ years of experience, including industrial drug discovery; or Master's Degree or equivalent with typically 12 - 14+ years of experience; or Bachelor's Degree or equivalent with typically 14 - 16+ years of experience Significant accomplishments in neuroinflammation research and neurodegenerative disease drug discovery, with a strong record of publications and patents Expertise in neuroinflammation and microglial biology Expertise in relevant technologies, such as microglia or hematopoetic iPSC cell culture; genomics, transcriptomics, or proteomics; RNAi or CRISPR screening; flow cytometry; and high content phenotypic screening. Conduct and oversee the design, execution, and interpretation of novel bench research. Collaborate with colleagues at multiple AbbVie sites to identify and optimize drug leads to produce clinical candidates of outstanding promise. ', 'Stay abreast of, and contribute to, relevant literature.', 'Experience in working in multidisciplinary teams, and in external collaboration', 'Job Type', 'Schedule', "PhD in Neuroscience or related field, with typically 6 - 8+ years of experience, including industrial drug discovery; or Master's Degree or equivalent with typically 12 - 14+ years of experience; or Bachelor's Degree or equivalent with typically 14 - 16+ years of experience", 'Expertise in relevant technologies, such as microglia or hematopoetic iPSC cell culture; genomics, transcriptomics, or proteomics; RNAi or CRISPR screening; flow cytometry; and high content phenotypic screening. ['Send CV and inquiries to: drn2112@columbia.edu; rsf2106@columbia.edu', 'Skills desired: (i) Working knowledge and/or experience in flotation, (ii) hands-on laboratory experience, (iii) experimental design, statistics and data analysis, (iv) good knowledge of chemistry is preferred (especially organic and polymer chemistry). Visit to a mine site outside of the US to conduct lab and plant studies is required; may involve two visits of ~2-week duration per year.', 'Sustainable Mining, Minerals and Materials', 'You would be working with two seasoned industry professionals who have recently begun an academic program on Sustainable Mining, Minerals and Materials in Columbia University’s department of Earth and Environmental Engineering.', 'We are accepting applications from a Postdoc candidate who has a good background or interest in Sustainable Mining/Minerals processing to work on an industry sponsored project. The project is sponsored by a large mining company for at least two years. The title of the project is “Recovery of value minerals from sulfide ore processing plant ore mineral streams, including tailings, via Innovative Flotation Technologies”.\xa0This project requires a significant amount of laboratory work, which will be conducted in an off-campus mineral processing research facility. ']

['', 'Developing the proposed clinical milestones with the Clinical Sub-team', 'Clinical Program Lead', 'Minimum 4 years of clinical/research experience in the pharmaceutical/device industry preferred.', ' As the Clinical Scientist, be responsible and accountable for the scientific/clinical implementation of the Clinical Development Plan at the Clinical Trial Team level. The position supports the Clinical Project Lead and Clinical Science Lead in the development of the Clinical Development Plan and associated clinical trial content (e.g., protocols, IBs/IDFUs, CRFs, CSRs, regulatory submissions and publications)', 'Relevant science degree (e.g., Masters, MD, PharmD, PhD); Scientific knowledge and experience in the relevant Therapeutic Area (Devices) preferred.', ' As the Clinical Program Lead, be responsible and accountable for the development, implementation and delivery of the global clinical development strategy for a given project within time, budget and with high quality. This will entail leading the development of the Clinical Development Plan in collaboration with the Clinical Science Lead and members of the Clinical Sub-Team and ensuring alignment with the agreed Global Development Strategy. ['', 'At Least 3 Year Of Experience Managing People', ' At least 3 year of experience working with AWS ', ' Partner with senior leaders and partner teams in problem framing and conception of ideas, develop consensus and execute on the machine learning agenda ', ' Build and deliver a comprehensive machine learning roadmap across bank customer life cycle from account opening to account management that enables customer base growth and faster access to money while preventing fraudulent activity ', ' Partner with a cross-functional team of product managers, software engineers, and business analysts to launch machine learning solutions into production ', 'The Ideal Candidate Is', ' Team oriented: You excel at partnering with cross functional teams to champion the field of data science achieve collective goals ', " Bachelor's Degree plus 9 years of experience in data analytics, or Master's Degree plus 7 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD plus 5 years of experience in data analytics ", ' At least 5 years of experience in Python, Scala, or R for large scale data analysis ', 'At Least 4 Years Of Experience With Machine Learning', ' Lead a data science team and build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design, testing, data gathering, training, evaluation, validation, and implementation ', ' Lead, recruit, and grow a team of data scientists to achieve their professional goals ', ' PhD in Computer Science (Machine Learning, Statistics, Math or equivalent) plus 5 years of experience in data analytics ', ' Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.', 'Basic Qualifications', ' Achiever. You at ease in a fast pace environment defending against fraud and are driven for action and get things done ', 'In This Role, You Will', ' At least 4 years of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis ', " The Customer Protection Data Science team has a relentless focus on the craft of data sciences spanning statistics, machine learning and distributed computing domains. Our relentless innovation is aimed towards continually identifying fraud attacks across every stage of the customer life cycle. You will be working with cross functional teams including product, engineers and business analysts to identify and enable real-time intelligent decisions as part of our defenses. This is core to delivering the Bank's mission of Changing Banking for Good as it will enable easy access to banking services to all consumers. ", ' At least 4 years of experience with relational databases ', " A Leader. You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. You're passionate about talent development for your own team and beyond ", " As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you'll be part of a team that's leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in computing technologies and machine learning methods that operate across billions of customer records to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time and agony in their financial lives. ", ' Identify, evaluate, and deploy new algorithms, data strategies, testing strategy, and implementation capabilities to drive continuous innovation ', ' Innovative. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them ', " The mission of this role is to drive the continual transformation of Capital One Consumer Bank's Customer Protection Data Science division. As the leading machine learning group, defining the next generation of banking, you will drive innovation that hardens our defenses against various types of bank fraud. In this role, you'll be central to determining our vision and strategy for machine learning applications in fraud detection and prevention that deeply impact the lives and financial freedom of our 12 million consumer bank customers. ", ' Actively identify and manage model risks in line with model risk management policies ', 'Preferred Qualifications', ' Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup, we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. ', " Experienced. You've built machine learning models over TB scale data, validated them, back tested them and know what it takes to launch them in a real-time production environment ", ' At least 10 years of experience applying machine learning to solve complex problems for large scale applications ', ' Build and deliver a comprehensive machine learning roadmap across bank customer life cycle from account opening to account management that enables customer base growth and faster access to money while preventing fraudulent activity  Partner with senior leaders and partner teams in problem framing and conception of ideas, develop consensus and execute on the machine learning agenda  Lead a data science team and build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design, testing, data gathering, training, evaluation, validation, and implementation  Partner with a cross-functional team of product managers, software engineers, and business analysts to launch machine learning solutions into production  Actively identify and manage model risks in line with model risk management policies  Identify, evaluate, and deploy new algorithms, data strategies, testing strategy, and implementation capabilities to drive continuous innovation  Lead, recruit, and grow a team of data scientists to achieve their professional goals ']

['', 'Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.', 'Participating in thought leadership activities in the Big Data and analytics space;', 'Prioritizing and handling multiple tasks, research and analyze pertinent client, industry and technical matters, utilize problem-solving skills, and communicate effectively in written and verbal formats to various audiences (including various levels of management and external clients) in a professional business environment; and,', "Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.", 'Minimum Years Of Experience', 'Developing blueprints and technical playbooks for complex Big Data analytics solutions;', 'Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.', 'Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.', 'Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.', 'Demonstrates Extensive Abilities And/or a Proven Record Of Success Executing Various Aspects Of Client Engagements And/or Projects Within a Professional Services Environment, Including The Following Areas', 'Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.', 'Utilizing cloud-based Data and Analytics platform solutions - SAS,R,Python, Machine Learning etc.);Understanding data and analytics integration, application architecture interlocking unstructured and structured data within the enterprise;Developing of Data warehouses hosted on MPP (massively parallel processing) architecture, distributed systems and analytics platforms;Utilizing cloud-based Data and Analytics platform solutions - ['', "At least 2 years' experience working with Cloud environments", 'A data guru. "Big data" doesn\'t phase you. You have the skills to retrieve, combine, and analyze data from a variety of sources and structures. You know understanding the data is often the key to great data science.', 'Technical: You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions, from concept to production, and selecting the right tool for the job at hand. You understand modern cloud computing and have a solid foundation in statistics. You have experience prototyping and implementing data science solutions in a financial institution. You know Python, Spark, and/or R.', 'Leveraging extensive, deep technical knowledge and team leadership skills to drive the development of data science solutions and implement data-driven recommendations and outcomes;', "At least 7 years' experience with statistics or machine learning", 'At least 4 years of experience with machine learning', 'Leading multiple initiatives involving exploration and analysis of data across a variety of data platforms;', 'Leader. You challenge conventional thinking and traditional ways of operating and you work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo.', 'At least 4 years of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis', 'Developing and deploying predictive models to better understand and manage our credit risk and exposure;', 'Communicator: You can communicate complex ideas clearly. Your team knows their priorities and you manage expectations with your broader cross-functional stakeholder network ad leadership team', 'Basic Qualifications', 'Technical: You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions, from concept to production, and selecting the right tool for the job at hand. You understand modern cloud computing and have a solid foundation in statistics. You have experience prototyping and implementing data science solutions in a financial institution. You know Python, Spark, and/or R.A data guru. "Big data" doesn\'t phase you. You have the skills to retrieve, combine, and analyze data from a variety of sources and structures. You know understanding the data is often the key to great data science.Communicator: You can communicate complex ideas clearly. Your team knows their priorities and you manage expectations with your broader cross-functional stakeholder network ad leadership teamInnovative, but also results-focused. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them.Customer & Business-Minded. You have an astute ability to understand the customer and business problem that is to be solved and can drive towards impactful outcomes.Leader. You challenge conventional thinking and traditional ways of operating and you work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo.', "Bachelor's Degree plus 9 years of experience in data analytics, or Master's Degree plus 7 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD plus 4 years of experience in data analytics", 'Customer & Business-Minded. You have an astute ability to understand the customer and business problem that is to be solved and can drive towards impactful outcomes.', 'PhD in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 5 years of experience in data analytics', 'PhD in "STEM" field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 5 years of experience in data analyticsAt least 2 years\' experience working with Cloud environmentsAt least 1 year experience managing peopleAt least 5 years\' experience in Python, Scala, R, Spark, or other modern programming languageAt least 7 years\' experience with statistics or machine learning', 'Innovative, but also results-focused. You continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them.', "On Any Given Day You'll Be", 'At least 4 years of experience with relational databases', 'At least 1 year experience managing people', "At least 5 years' experience in Python, Scala, R, Spark, or other modern programming language", 'Motivating and mentoring the Modeling & Data team of data scientists and quantitative modelers to deepen their understanding and use of cutting edge data science and machine learning methods;', 'The Ideal Candidate Will Be', "Bachelor's Degree plus 9 years of experience in data analytics, or Master's Degree plus 7 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD plus 4 years of experience in data analyticsAt least 4 years of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysisAt least 4 years of experience with machine learningAt least 4 years of experience with relational databases", 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Evaluating the landscape of tools to understand what will unlock new capabilities and performance and what is just a distraction;Leading multiple initiatives involving exploration and analysis of data across a variety of data platforms;Motivating and mentoring the Modeling & Data team of data scientists and quantitative modelers to deepen their understanding and use of cutting edge data science and machine learning methods;Leveraging extensive, deep technical knowledge and team leadership skills to drive the development of data science solutions and implement data-driven recommendations and outcomes;Developing and deploying predictive models to better understand and manage our credit risk and exposure;Collaborating with data engineers, data scientists, product managers, and other business analysts to create a nimble and resilient modeling infrastructure that enables CICD;', 'Collaborating with data engineers, data scientists, product managers, and other business analysts to create a nimble and resilient modeling infrastructure that enables CICD;', 'Team Description', 'Evaluating the landscape of tools to understand what will unlock new capabilities and performance and what is just a distraction;']

job_title: Pricing Scientist / Advanced Analytics - Manager - TMT
job_text: ['', 'Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.', 'Required Fields Of Study', "Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.", 'Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.', 'Experience with parallel and distributed approaches to data analytics', 'Explore and identify expanded data models for addressing client problems, going beyond customer internal transaction data to include external, unstructured data including forecasts, market information, econometric and social media data and inputs', 'Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.', 'Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.', 'Be the public face of PwC’s algorithmic and mathematical research efforts, meeting with customers and speaking at both client and industry external events', 'Ideally an advanced degree in Operations Research, Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics or Engineering8+ years of hands on experience in applying advanced algorithms to address real world business problems with a focus on pricing and customer profitabilityExperience with large-scale data analysis frameworks such as map-reduce (Hadoop ecosystem), NoSQL and in-memory / columnar databasesExperience with pricing software applications, e.g., Vendavo, PROS, ZilliantExperience with parallel and distributed approaches to data analyticsExperience with data analysis tools such as R, SAS, SPSS, MathematicaExperience with data analytics in the cloud: Azure, AWS, Google.Exceptional team player, leadership, mentoring and coaching skillsExcellent communication, coordination and presentation skills.', 'Exceptional team player, leadership, mentoring and coaching skills', 'Requirements', 'Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.', 'Responsibilities', 'Experience with data analysis tools such as R, SAS, SPSS, Mathematica', "Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.", 'Excellent communication, coordination and presentation skills.', '8+ years of hands on experience in applying advanced algorithms to address real world business problems with a focus on pricing and customer profitability', 'Basic Qualifications', "Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.", 'Employ techniques from machine learning, statistical analysis and predictive modeling to deliver business insights and recommendations to prospects and customers based on data.', 'Ideally an advanced degree in Operations Research, Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics or Engineering', 'Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.', 'Employ techniques from machine learning, statistical analysis and predictive modeling to deliver business insights and recommendations to prospects and customers based on data.Lead and Supervise creation and application of Algorithms to identify and quantify pricing opportunitiesExplore and identify expanded data models for addressing client problems, going beyond customer internal transaction data to include external, unstructured data including forecasts, market information, econometric and social media data and inputsTake on a lead role in handling difficult algorithm issues including price optimization, clustering, and causality/correlationBe the public face of PwC’s algorithmic and mathematical research efforts, meeting with customers and speaking at both client and industry external events', 'PwC Professional Skills And Responsibilities For This Management Level Include But Are Not Limited To', 'Minimum Degree Required', 'Lead and Supervise creation and application of Algorithms to identify and quantify pricing opportunities', 'Experience with data analytics in the cloud: Azure, AWS, Google.', 'Experience with large-scale data analysis frameworks such as map-reduce (Hadoop ecosystem), NoSQL and in-memory / columnar databases', 'Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.', 'Travel Required', 'Take on a lead role in handling difficult algorithm issues including price optimization, clustering, and causality/correlation', 'Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.', 'For positions based in San Francisco, consideration of qualified candidates with arrest and conviction records will be in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.', 'Experience with pricing software applications, e.g., Vendavo, PROS, Zilliant', 'Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.']
